query: When were key personnel changes made during the inspection?
output:
CLAUDE CODE ANALYSIS
Query: When were key personnel changes made during the inspection?

RELEVANT DOCUMENT EXCERPTS:

[Leonard Beauchemin Outline #1.docx, p.1]
You were retained by Gulfstream’s counsel to critique the Farnham report, correct?

[Opening Statement.docx, p.1]
Any mention that discrepancy repairs were excluded;

[Opening Statement.docx, p.1]
Lost profits, failed sale, and out-of-pocket costs were entirely predictable from the moment Gulfstream refused to update the quote.

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Show he knew prior downtime estimates were unreliable:

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
You were involved in or approved the 192-month inspection proposal for G550 serial number 5174?

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
Direct your attention to the June 23, 2023 email thread—Subject: “2023 Labor Rates - Downtime Talking Points.” You were the sender of these documents, correct?

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
These talking points were intended to guide both internal and customer-facing messaging on downtime estimates?

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
You were aware that Gulfstream introduced new “data collection and analytical capabilities” around July 2023?

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
You were also copied on presentations about downtime estimation modeling—Bates GAC0000173.

[Craig Klebe Outline #1.docx, p.1]
No indication these were shared with CITIOM or used to update the quote?
